Old computer monitors, take up quite a bit of desktop space, put out a ton of heat, drain a ton of energy, and most often have low picture quality and resolution. Modern advances with the LCD computer monitors have changed a lot of that. The screen itself is flat, and very thin, needing very little desktop space, therefore giving you more room while working at your PC. A big advantage in my opinion is that LCD monitors don’t put off all the heat that the old monitors do. Those old monitors could quickly heat up a room, especially if you have more than one in the same space. LCD monitors require very little energy, making your wallet a little fatter by avoiding high energy bills. LCD monitors also reduce the glare, making them a better choice for gamers, and anyone who spends a lot of time in front of their computer.<br>"}},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":262,"children":[263]},{"type":"Block","_id":263,"styles":{"all":{"&":"display: flex;"},"mobile":{"&":"display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap;"}},"children":[264,268]},{"type":"Block","_id":264,"styles":{"all":{"&":"min-width: 130px; text-align: center;"},"mobile":{"&":"width: 100%;"}},"children":[265,266,267]},{"type":"Image","_id":265,"styles":{"all":{"&":"margin: 0px 0px 20px;"}},"src":"https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/avatar03png-1514533045787.png"},{"type":"Heading","_id":266,"styles":{"all":{"&":"font-size: 18px; font-weight: 700; margin: 0px 0px 5px;"}},"_title":{"text":"Maria Holmes"}},{"type":"Paragraph","_id":267,"styles":{"all":{"&":"font-size: 16px;"},"mobile":{"&":"margin-bottom: 20px;"}},"_text":{"text":"Model"}},{"type":"Paragraph","_id":268,"styles":{"all":{"&":"font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 30px;"},"mobile":{"&":"font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; padding: 0px;"}},"_text":{"text":"There are plenty of free web proxy sites that you can use. data-element="ce16d0ae-5981-4822-9da2-aad783884d96" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-b5122d1f sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="d84cbbde-1de6-46ba-a595-0f1d2815f88f" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-e409e6e4 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="6bc53be0-5a00-45bd-8d54-366f4dd555eb" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Store Manager</span></p></div><p class="pf-8edd41af sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="a8a3be00-af4c-427a-a32f-768fd3f4dd39" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-431f43bd sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="8fed81d5-ed2e-471d-84e9-e07f1ec860d7" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Having used discount toner cartridges for twenty years, there have been a lot of changes in the toner cartridge market. The market today is approximately a twenty billion dollar business. The savings today are significant. The quality of the discount cartridges is unsurpassed. To insure your complete satisfaction in purchasing discount toner, take a minute to make an informed choice. The problem was that the drill and fill cartridges produced poor quality and printed fewer pages. They were very inconsistent from cartridge to cartridge. In short, there was no quality control. One discount toner cartridge might perform great and the next may not.<br><br>However, things have changed significantly. Today, discount toner cartridges are brand new cartridges made from brand new parts… the same parts specified in your OEM printer manual. The technology is the same as that used by major printer manufacturers. Today, a reputable discount toner company uses the same components as major printer companies. Their toner, drums and rollers are the same quality and specification.<br></span></p></div></div> </div><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 0px;"><div class="pf-688a1dbb sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="1d641e77-5ad8-4edd-b027-609be471ca97" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><div class="pf-9f4c8c5e sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="47d3b6ab-3632-4bd9-bac1-9d59b3c09d48" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><div class="pf-f72dd42e sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="4efdfac6-8ba6-45c7-8c38-7d007a18f258" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-6229bb71 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="dd047a02-436d-4171-8c3e-9ed3c4125b26" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/avatar02png-1514533042537.png"></picture><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-e748b9bd sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="3bbcfa57-024d-470f-a672-93055b799d2f" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-98b019f6 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="b7b0aafc-8683-425d-be73-c0940767c777" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Lewis Todd</span></h3><p class="pf-e7819ba5 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="7b226e2f-4fb7-40d7-af16-3998ae75631a" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-f94e7445 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a85b9a09-250e-46ce-a3d2-e5a0b7bc691d" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Designer</span></p></div><p class="pf-e54893da sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="d32ad5f9-4ffd-4093-a50e-9293a41ea6ae" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-41478f6d sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="eb7556a0-7e31-4bb4-a258-7cc9d48a3f65" data-type="Text" draggable="true">There are advances being made in science and technology everyday, and a good example of this is the LCD monitor. LCD monitors have several benefits over the old chunky computer monitors that most users are familiar with. Old computer monitors, take up quite a bit of desktop space, put out a ton of heat, drain a ton of energy, and most often have low picture quality and resolution. Modern advances with the LCD computer monitors have changed a lot of that. The screen itself is flat, and very thin, needing very little desktop space, therefore giving you more room while working at your PC. A big advantage in my opinion is that LCD monitors don’t put off all the heat that the old monitors do. Those old monitors could quickly heat up a room, especially if you have more than one in the same space. LCD monitors require very little energy, making your wallet a little fatter by avoiding high energy bills. LCD monitors also reduce the glare, making them a better choice for gamers, and anyone who spends a lot of time in front of their computer.<br></span></p></div></div> </div><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 0px;"><div class="pf-a433e93f sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="0c17b886-572f-487b-a00e-7d9a3adaef1a" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><div class="pf-182aa619 sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="41565398-2c86-4695-b4e4-b2a83c414a58" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><div class="pf-86d4b515 sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="f4986c43-3f0b-43a6-833e-dfe3716d337a" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-43e84e78 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="a5977aa9-0ee7-45f5-8515-dafd427cef0c" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/avatar03png-1514533045787.png"></picture><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-c5aa5665 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="08df6d67-846d-49b8-818f-9800f696c5ed" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-ab6171b4 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="1c6cf016-f280-4459-8d4f-66616e28cc61" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Maria Holmes</span></h3><p class="pf-05b67400 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="237b1c7d-cedb-4d5e-b62d-9c9719317b57" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-950b5aa4 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="ed375c8e-d6d5-40be-b0ab-30cbffb9472b" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Model</span></p></div><p class="pf-f85f0696 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="e96bc14a-40ed-4d5c-90fb-2261aced50c5" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-47db15fe sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a562cb5d-6aea-4fa8-8694-69a888e71b28" data-type="Text" draggable="true">There are plenty of free web proxy sites that you can use. The problem is that many of the popular ones also get blocked by people at your school, company or government. However, once you find one that is not blocked, all you do is go to the proxy site, enter the URL you want to browse and click go! Its that easy.<br><br>You can then click on any links in the page you are browsing and you’re still anonymous to the outside world. Just remember that if you go to a proxy and its blocked or no longer works, its no big deal, there are thousands of them. Just try another one and eventually you will find a web proxy that lets you browse freely and privately.<br></span></p></div></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-3a596c4a sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="800fa70f-1f16-4ea6-9a3d-5226576efb6d" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-ff9d4f06 pb-grid pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="6d4c05b4-4270-46e0-8369-887c6c957c7a" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-ebea48d2 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="3229f8c0-cce1-424c-b4e4-fcba3fb6d8e8" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-3c923db2 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="cc043498-11b3-4b92-bc52-60463ef75525" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-d4d281e3 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="ae227bac-3578-4080-b835-27ec323628c2" data-type="Text" draggable="true">BOSE QuietComfort 35</span></h3><p class="pf-a9aff263 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="6fda8843-ecf7-4d61-b283-a353746c8bff" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-fa22a8c6 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="6697c75d-39da-4562-936e-66e130c290a4" data-type="Text" draggable="true">There are advances being made in science and technology everyday, and a good example of this is the LCD monitor. class="accordion__arrow fa fa-caret-right"></i>WHAT ARE THE THINGS I SHOULD NOTICE ABOUT T BOSE QUIETCOMFORT II?</a><div class="accordion__content sc-iQKALj klMwny" style="display: none;"><p contenteditable="true" class="pf-bd497ce1 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="3cc52d69-37e6-43a1-9695-f8d4fe4fd223" data-type="Text" draggable="true">WordPress, the premier free open-source blogging utility, has gone through several upgrades in its life. Today it’s one of the most popular blogging tools on the Internet; it’s easy to use, powerful, and very versatile. It also has a very active base of skilled users who are eager to improve the product and to help out those who haven’t tried it before.<br><br>Though the Strayhorn 1.5 version is the favorite for many, it is not as stable or as secure as the newest version 2.0.3. The best part of the new version is the security patch; the new “nonce” security key reduces the chances of a malicious hacker finding a way into your admin panel. Besides the security patch, though, several minor bugs have been squashed with this version. Though a major upgrade to 2.1 is due out soon, the 2.0.3 is something you should definitely download and install if only because of the security fixes, which were actually backported from the major upgrade files.<br></span></p></div></div><div class="pf-8f1aeb0f accordion__item sc-RefOD jjtuvG" data-element="35a0f093-370b-49ab-897f-6f20847eee8f" data-type="Content.Accordion" draggable="true"><a id="35a0f093-370b-49ab-897f-6f20847eee8f" class="accordion__header sc-bwCtUz cGpoQ" data-preopen="false" data-active="false"><i class="accordion__arrow fa fa-caret-right"></i>WHAT COME WITH THE BOSE BOX?</a><div class="accordion__content sc-iQKALj klMwny" style="display: none;"><p class="pf-bb953ab2 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="d3d15b14-133a-4d36-b934-13e4630db296" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-1a300678 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="107ad89f-8318-4093-b389-2f71a698da64" data-type="Text" draggable="true">In addition to the 2.0.3 install, you should be aware that some bugs have already been found, and that a plugin will need to be installed to repair those bugs. If you modify any of the files that this patch plugin fixes, you’ll need to either merge the changes with the new files or make those changes manually once again. You can find these issues by running a diff to locate changes; if the only changes you find are your own, then you’re fine, and otherwise you’ll need to merge them manually into the new files.</span></p></div></div><div class="pf-f8c0f142 accordion__item sc-RefOD jjtuvG" data-element="56227461-af04-4308-89a7-bd78302c3603" data-type="Content.Accordion" draggable="true"><a id="56227461-af04-4308-89a7-bd78302c3603" class="accordion__header sc-bwCtUz cGpoQ" data-preopen="false" data-active="false"><i class="accordion__arrow fa fa-caret-right"></i>WHAT ARE INCLUDING IN THE COMBO BOSE AND QC II?</a><div class="accordion__content sc-iQKALj klMwny" style="display: none;"><p class="pf-1e2780a2 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="2bfd51c7-edd5-4693-a133-1dbef5499dc4" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-c17f5806 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="41639802-2950-496f-995f-a028228c2b44" data-type="Text" draggable="true">If you are in the market for a computer, there are a number of factors to consider. Will it be used for your home, your office or perhaps even your home office combo? class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-75fb26af pb-grid pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="0cdc5a55-0ffc-40ab-a19a-ad721ed9c44a" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-two-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-ef114aeb sc-fhYwyz qWDtS" data-element="8b914629-d177-49f5-931f-545a52e5364c" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><span data-placeholder="true">Column</span></div> </div><div class="pb-eight-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-cfb76414 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="ca8ef374-b513-4513-b59d-d4086f1e9882" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-08fb965e sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="ad21bfc3-d2d8-4f5b-ac1f-fd2b1c545fc1" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-19524971 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a017487e-5e14-40bc-b72d-5b40e4fa70b2" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Contemporary Ceramics Shop in conversation with Lorna Fraser<br></span></h3><p class="pf-180163ea sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="ea664f96-0e12-4a98-8ac5-994dc648d46a" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-833d2972 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="b44f5161-28b5-442f-a595-653a280dd7d1" data-type="Text" draggable="true">I fell in love with ceramics as soon as I tried it in my first year at art school. At that moment there was no turning back and I knew that clay was the material for me and I wanted to work in 3 dimensions. Ive never lost my love of working with clay and I just thrive on the process of making.</span></p><p class="pf-2567b7b0 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="4ea3e26c-52cb-40e2-9079-844fa7b0ed53" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-adc5e06a sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="108a7bf1-d244-441c-8a49-cfefe6145283" data-type="Text" draggable="true">It was a month of gentle goodbyes to Spring, as the days become warmer and longer and Summer finally beckons. A month of playing with soft sweet smelling lilac, and beautiful bold peonies, in my studio for styling opportunities, as I stretched my throwing skills further and experimented with new colour palettes with my porcelain slip casting.</span></p><div class="pf-8896e574 sc-lkqHmb bekBQz" data-element="dd7b1ade-de01-4b10-bcb0-3284a7da929b" data-type="Youtube" draggable="true"><div class="pb-video-wrap " style="padding-bottom: 56.25%;"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YZIk-5YRzxs?autoplay=0&amp;loop=0&amp;mute=0&amp;controls=0&amp;enablejsapi=1&amp;rel=0&amp;showinfo=1" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="" width="100%" height="100%" class="pb-video" allow="autoplay"></iframe></div></div><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-38b0b2e8 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="ae33970b-8f90-40c6-bd56-6744320e4917" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-445464f8 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="8ce8bc39-9dd7-4dfc-9e3e-577ebb1bb4d8" data-type="Text" draggable="true">How do you work?</span></h3><p class="pf-2f4b000a sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="c0de1af4-652e-4898-a6d5-97c75047b603" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-dabbac56 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="db84d7a4-5b95-454a-830c-c841ee1c2703" data-type="Text" draggable="true">I am lucky enough to have a beautiful studio in the heart of Edinburgh. My studio is in a large building with over 50 artists. This has been a real advantage to my practice as I work in an enriching environment with painters, weavers, jewellers, printmakers as well as other ceramicists. This has fed my creativity and given me the confidence to incorporate other disciplines like printmaking and sculpture into my work. I dont do detailed drawings, preferring to scribble initial ideas into my sketchbook but finalising my designs in clay.&nbsp;<br>Im not a morning person and love nothing better than settling down in my studio, with Radio 4 playing in the background, and working late into the evening<br></span></p><picture class="pf-afd91b4a sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="04035a4f-8a3f-4652-9019-79d05a58ab69" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/photo1510828998924405b610a5eecjpeg-1525245878444.jpeg"></picture><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-c9235dd9 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="7b946616-5087-42ef-89d1-ea4dbcb0b80a" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-5fb1a2a3 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="8fe735a4-0946-491e-acee-462a8f53e635" data-type="Text" draggable="true">What advice would you give to others starting with clay?</span></h3><p class="pf-6d692ee1 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="ac120c75-a8f4-4e75-83a3-ca130fccc2f2" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-45c78ad2 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="e58c0397-8873-45b2-a08a-82786adc8c04" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Work hard and dont worry about making mistakes. I love playing with new ideas and never think of it as a waste of time. Even if these playdays come to nothing that very process will keep your love of clay alive.</span></p><picture class="pf-d5ce2ecc sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="a5d5d55f-ba45-43eb-8f03-6073281a0fb7" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/photo1508269151431a34449ca161djpeg-1525245887184.jpeg"></picture><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-ea81ea30 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="9c975621-4f0c-4e25-98e5-be66088dba3d" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-df6094c7 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a4266598-659e-4e42-aaf7-047b73aecf2d" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Lorem ipsum dolor</span></h3><p class="pf-0a54f9af sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="c60aa596-f45b-4f17-b857-3b4e4ce1ab28" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-84a6260d sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="81b59394-9027-41ea-b0a8-79098ed1964a" data-type="Text" draggable="true">My work changed dramatically about 15 years ago. I used to make very richly decorated lustrous caskets inspired by Medieval reliquaries, but one day almost overnight I realised I had reached the end of the road with that work. I had had enough of colour and just stopped. I packed away all my glazes and lustres, ordered some samples of porcelain clay and started afresh. In hindsight it seems a rash thing to do but I have never regretted it.</span></p><picture class="pf-b1b5074f sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="8f45ffd9-c74e-452b-af5f-038bea1c833f" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/photo1523028157244c2827982798bjpeg-1525245896452.jpeg"></picture><picture class="pf-480bd3a0 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="fa04cd38-62ab-4e9a-ac74-6a6f29818136" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/photo14984800860042400bd8c3663jpeg-1525245906507.jpeg"></picture><picture class="pf-99405d6a sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="92e4cdd8-0f7c-4740-8d60-d86429dd3fa4" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/photo1523263889714d345f8119047jpeg-1525245914290.jpeg"></picture><picture class="pf-9fd59f21 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" There are several active ingredients that have been clinically proven to be effective skin rejuvenators. One of the most effective treatments is vitamin A derivatives such a retinol or retinyl palmitate.&nbsp;<br><br>The Retin A or Renova vitamin A treatments are the strongest although the most irritating treatments of the vitamin A options and are only available by prescription. If your skin needs major rejuvenation attention, ask your Doctor if you are a candidate for the prescription vitamin A treatment of Retin A or Renova. If not, including one of the other retinol alternatives in your skin care routine is an excellent strategy. The concentration of over-the-counter retinol products can range up to 1%. The basic rule of thumb is, the higher the concentration, the stronger the treatment. Be forewarned though, read the directions carefully because the stronger retinol products can be quite irritating to the skin. Starting slow and gradually working your way up to higher concentrations will allow your skin to adjust to the treatments better. The vitamin A derivative, Retinyl Palmitate, is the less irritating of the Vitamin A options and is considered to have quite effective rejuvenating qualities. Cosmetic products are defined as, “a substance or preparation intended for placement in contact with any external part of the human body”. This definition can include a variety of products.<br><br>Shampoos and soaps are products that usually contain some kind of fragrance and clean the skin by the use of surface-active agents, or surfactants. These surfactants are molecules that have both lipophilic and hydrophilic, or fat soluble and water soluble parts. The fat soluble part of the product clings to the oil and dirt as the water soluble part allows the lipophilic part to be washed away. Detergents for dishes and clothes work in pretty much the same way but will have different ingredients that make them more harsh for use on hard, solid surfaces. It is usually not a good idea to try and use these detergents on the body and hair, for it can lead to irritation.<br>"}},{"type":"Divider","_id":353,"styles":{"all":{"&":"color: rgb(198, 198, 198); font-size: 1px; padding: 40px 0px;"}}},{"type":"Section","_id":354,"styles":{"all":{"&":"background-size: cover; background-position: center center; padding: 45px 0px;"}},"children":[355],"sectionName":"Section #8"},{"type":"Row","_id":355,"children":[356,357,363]},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":356,"hideOnTablet":true,"hideOnMobile":true,"children":[],"size":1,"computer":1,"tablet":1,"mobile":1},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":357,"styles":{"all":{"&":"text-align: center; padding: 0px 80px;"},"mobile":{"&":"padding: 0px;"}},"children":[358,359,360,361,362],"size":10,"computer":10,"tablet":12,"mobile":10},{"type":"Image","_id":358,"styles":{"all":{"&":"width: 100%; height: 500px;"}}},{"type":"Heading","_id":359,"styles":{"all":{"&":"font-size: 36px; line-height: 1; margin: 30px 0px 10px;"}},"preset":7,"_title":{"text":"The Essential of Red Wood No.07"}},{"type":"Heading","_id":360,"styles":{"all":{"&":"margin: 0px 0px 30px; font-size: 24px; font-weight: 700; color: rgb(236, 88, 0);"}},"_title":{"text":"$379.00"}},{"type":"Paragraph","_id":361,"styles":{"all":{"&":"margin: 0px 0px 30px;"}},"preset":237,"_text":{"text":"At some stage in all our lives we want clearer, fresher, younger looking skin. sc-exAgwC hvubEE" data-element="a3aafb70-5383-4ec3-b9a8-24ab385117d9" data-type="Layout" draggable="true"><div data-container="true" class="pf-4fa58524 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="00cb7a0c-835f-46d6-9ed0-d684c86d1fed" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-5b748cba pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="240378eb-0254-40f7-9b6e-7323d32aabc3" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-one-twelfth pb-mobile--one-twelfth pb-tablet--one-twelfth grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-d4a15054 pb-tablet--hidden pb-mobile--hidden sc-fhYwyz qWDtS" data-element="a230b901-9160-43cf-9b11-57cf79f8b3c6" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><span data-placeholder="true">Column</span></div> </div><div class="pb-ten-twelfths pb-mobile--ten-twelfths pb-tablet--one-whole twelfths-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-848cadf3 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="927bfdfc-1d42-474f-b4b6-f82b72470fcb" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-38d622be sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="71d083ae-9967-4da7-bd38-fa720d13daa5" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-fb5f746d sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="8d0ac2c7-64da-49cc-a8d2-69ac423213cc" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Beauty is in the eye of beholder</span></h3><p class="pf-6f0fefa1 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="1a1ac5a7-096a-42c9-b441-323b568b6e1e" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-f52c945c sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="2493d2f9-857d-48cc-8bcc-119874154acf" data-type="Text" draggable="true">One way to reduce the appearance of lines and wrinkles is to use products that deliver powerful antioxidants like vitamin C to your skin. The best vitamin C skin care products will neutralize free radicals, boost the skin’s ability to produce collagen, reduce discoloration, and improve skin texture.<br><br>Hydroxy acids are another key. Some skin care products are so high in hydroxy acid that a toner is necessary to prepare skin. Skin that benefits from high levels of hydroxy acids will be able to produce more collagen and elastin. This reduces lines and wrinkles.<br><br>After treating your skin with vitamin C, toner, and hydroxy acids, a quality moisturizer and sun block is essential. Sun block must be worn every day, and it must block UVA and UVB rays because sun is the primary cause of older looking skin. Products with antioxidants that reduce damage from the sun are important, but nothing can substitute for an effective sun block.<br></span></p></div> </div><div class="pb-one-twelfth draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-67722941 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="b16b117a-4054-4151-8eec-2dfd96d05772" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-52d3ee4d sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="31111379-4933-472e-b5da-8fde0c8fd81f" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Isabelle Myers</span></h3><p class="pf-683940d6 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="83f04fe9-6b15-4087-a12b-2198c2e80e3d" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-07423401 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a065ade2-1a4c-414b-8c0b-ba3aca7dc421" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Growth Marketer @PageFly</span></p></div></div><p class="pf-08cf57b1 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="d8745430-ce19-4fdb-b9fa-e785db694f0f" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-47706b00 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a0e36986-1db5-4143-84c4-c2a378328748" data-type="Text" draggable="true">The basics of effective skin rejuvenation begin with the facts on anti-aging skin care treatments. There are several active ingredients that have been clinically proven to be effective skin rejuvenators. One of the most effective treatments is vitamin A derivatives such a retinol or retinyl palmitate.&nbsp;<br><br>The Retin A or Renova vitamin A treatments are the strongest although the most irritating treatments of the vitamin A options and are only available by prescription. If your skin needs major rejuvenation attention, ask your Doctor if you are a candidate for the prescription vitamin A treatment of Retin A or Renova. If not, including one of the other retinol alternatives in your skin care routine is an excellent strategy. The concentration of over-the-counter retinol products can range up to 1%. The basic rule of thumb is, the higher the concentration, the stronger the treatment. Be forewarned though, read the directions carefully because the stronger retinol products can be quite irritating to the skin. Starting slow and gradually working your way up to higher concentrations will allow your skin to adjust to the treatments better. The vitamin A derivative, Retinyl Palmitate, is the less irritating of the Vitamin A options and is considered to have quite effective rejuvenating qualities. The next most beneficial anti-aging skin rejuvenation treatment is a chemical exfoliant such as an alpha hydroxyl acid (AHA) or beta hydroxyl acid (BHA) product.<br></span></p></div></div> </div><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-b62b1b22 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="857e1eeb-8fac-467c-97b5-b44afa6d613a" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><div class="pf-076e85de sc-hZSUBg epWSjt" data-element="3b73b3c3-877b-4645-b70d-980ebf1a167b" data-type="Divider" draggable="true"></div></div> </div><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-703ccf0c sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="1ddf5b68-44c3-4e68-b1c1-f1a621ea3f7e" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><div class="pf-b49ba6d0 sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="bd299104-225b-49fa-a1cb-90d7436f44e6" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><div class="pf-1f4e3d04 sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="38e11204-fc30-4fe2-b586-f8af4d270604" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-384f757f sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="60fecfbc-b1e1-480e-b353-ecd468d4572e" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/avt2png-1514873044493.png"></picture><div class="pf-483ba98c sc-hrWEMg fOsrtz" data-element="c3497120-dd53-419f-ad9e-1b22ece83684" data-type="Block" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-29238e67 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="a6654cff-ab32-4fb7-a05e-75cc204039ab" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-f62ee499 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="641ad6e8-7807-4eb4-8fcd-889b9bed5e98" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Jean Townsend</span></h3><p class="pf-eff14bc2 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="ced021ee-93c4-49d7-b0d6-b54824d51bfa" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-2039f802 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="725d777c-570f-4fdf-9467-5dd7e77981c9" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Freenlance Photographer</span></p></div></div><p class="pf-9243d4a4 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="4de3af53-1c42-4ba2-8863-88c7d341874f" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-54b26351 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="093ab240-a834-4111-851b-c87d10e5a167" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Make-up and cosmetics are used all over the world by all kinds of different people. Cosmetic products are defined as, “a substance or preparation intended for placement in contact with any external part of the human body”. This definition can include a variety of products.<br><br>Shampoos and soaps are products that usually contain some kind of fragrance and clean the skin by the use of surface-active agents, or surfactants. These surfactants are molecules that have both lipophilic and hydrophilic, or fat soluble and water soluble parts. The fat soluble part of the product clings to the oil and dirt as the water soluble part allows the lipophilic part to be washed away. Detergents for dishes and clothes work in pretty much the same way but will have different ingredients that make them more harsh for use on hard, solid surfaces. It is usually not a good idea to try and use these detergents on the body and hair, for it can lead to irritation.<br></span></p></div></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-6f9a66a6 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="ac2d6485-fdff-426d-80dd-ba48c12a254b" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, The United States has the baseball cap, Britain is famous for the London bobby's helmet. Greece is associated with the fisherman's hat, while the beret is the symbol of France. The Israelis use the yarmulke and we usually see the Saudi Arabians in their white headdresses. Indian Sikhs wrap their heads in elaborate turbans while Russians warm their craniums with fur hats, which are of good use even at fifty Degree Celsius below zero. In Vietnam, the national chapeau is the non, or conical peasant hat. The story is about a giant woman from the sky who has protected humankind from a deluge of rain. She wore a hat made of four round shaped leaves to guard against all the rain. After the Goddess was gone, Vietnamese built a temple to commemorate her as the Rain-shielding Goddess.<br><br>Among conical hats, the nón lá of the Vietnamese people forms a perfect right circular cone which tapers smoothly from the base to the apex. Special conical hats in Vietnam contain colourful hand-stitch depictions or words while the Huế varieties are famous for their nón bài thơ (literally: poem conical hats). These contain random poetic verses and Hán tự which can be revealed when the hat is directed above one's head in the sunlight. Today, it has become part of Vietnam's national costume.<br>"}},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":144,"children":[143],"size":6,"computer":6,"tablet":12,"mobile":12},{"type":"Section","_id":145,"children":[146,149],"sectionName":"Section #9"},{"type":"Row","_id":146,"children":[147]},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":147,"children":[148]},{"type":"Heading","_id":148,"styles":{"all":{"&":"margin: 0px 0px 5px; font-size: 36px; line-height: 42px;"},"mobile":{"&":"font-size: 24px; line-height: 30px;"}},"tag":"h2","preset":117,"_title":{"text":"<span style=\"font-weight: 700;\">Vietnam and its magnificent beauty</span><br>"},"_icon":{"icon":"star"}},{"type":"Row","_id":149,"children":[150,156,158,160],"align":"center","doubling":true,"equals":false},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":150,"children":[151],"size":6,"computer":6,"tablet":12,"mobile":12},{"type":"Image","_id":151,"styles":{"all":{"&":"width: 100%;"}},"src":"https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/1jpg-1525857686955.jpg"},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":156,"children":[161],"size":6,"computer":6,"tablet":12,"mobile":12},{"type":"Image","_id":157,"styles":{"all":{"&":"width: 100%;"}},"src":"https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/3jpg-1525857701338.jpg"},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":158,"children":[159],"size":6,"computer":6,"tablet":6,"mobile":12},{"type":"Image","_id":159,"styles":{"all":{"&":"width: 100%;"}},"src":"https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/2jpg-1525857693841.jpg"},{"type":"Row.Col","_id":160,"children":[157],"size":6,"computer":6,"tablet":6,"mobile":12},{"type":"Paragraph","_id":161,"_text":{"text":"Vietnam's culture has developed over the centuries from indigenous ancient Đông Sơn culture with wet rice agriculture as its economic base. Some elements of the national culture have Chinese origins, drawing on elements of Confucianism and Taoism in its traditional political system and philosophy. Vietnamese society is structured around làng (ancestral villages); all Vietnamese mark a common ancestral anniversary on the tenth day of the third lunar month. In recent centuries, the influences of Western cultures, most notably France and the United States, have become evident in Vietnam.<br><br>The traditional focuses of Vietnamese culture are humanity and harmony; family and community values are highly regarded. In the modern era, the cultural life of Vietnam has been deeply influenced by government-controlled media and cultural programs. For many decades, foreign cultural influences – especially those of Western origin – were shunned. However, since the 1990s, Vietnam has seen a greater exposure to Southeast Asian, European and American culture and media.<br>"}},{"type":"Divider","_id":162,"styles":{"all":{"&":"color: rgb(153, 153, 153); font-size: 1px; padding: 0px 0px 50px;"}}}],"salt":"pvt038ovjb9","id":"106140","pb_version":250,"created_version":230,"selected_template":""}<link rel="preload" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Lato:400|Oswald:400|Roboto:400|Bree+Serif:400|Droid+Serif:400|Mrs+Saint Delafield:400|Rubik:400|Tinos:400|Poppins:400|Open+Sans:400|Archivo+Narrow:400|Rochester:400|Playfair+Display:400|Raleway:400|Permanent+Marker:400|Rozha+One:400|Lobster+Two:400" as="style" onload="this.onload=null;this.rel='stylesheet'">

data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-1ce6ff39 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a8ec6576-194c-4a82-98cf-cd4463a4101a" data-type="Text" draggable="true"><b>05 KEY THINGS "NON LA" WORTH YOUR ATTENTION</b></span></h2></div> </div></div><div class="pf-f5611b3e pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="8dcc510e-baf0-4178-8ec1-08cce0e1ebe2" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-d6421502 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="53e731c0-fc45-4621-a712-c7750f9eca43" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-8b8ada0a sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="bbb70c49-93f0-4cd8-b52b-9fa1fca26e5d" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/imgjpg-1525855666392.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-4e009e9f sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="e786c929-54f2-4a82-8411-201fe3f11e13" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-8f442877 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="5676fd06-872e-4407-bc21-daf529a3a057" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-ceac33c6 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="37b3dce6-f795-424c-9eaa-d9b1668d7675" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Non la has its own origin</span></h3><p class="pf-9f120df9 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="cb3e423c-bb06-4ce3-8570-87f2c80090ab" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-c9be6426 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a7827d38-6242-492b-a175-63a78f4b5bfa" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Like many other traditional costumes of Vietnam, Non la has its own origin, coming from a legend related to the history of rice growing in Vietnam. The story is about a giant woman from the sky who has protected humankind from a deluge of rain. She wore a hat made of four round shaped leaves to guard against all the rain. After the Goddess was gone, Vietnamese built a temple to commemorate her as the Rain-shielding Goddess.<br><br>You may sometimes wonder where the moon came from. Was it a planet that traveled too close to Earth and was captured in our orbit? Actually, the prevailing theory of modern science is that the moon was the result of a large scale collision with the still developing Earth early in its development which caused this large “chuck” to spin off into an orbiting body. This explains the similarity in composition as has been confirmed by many of the moon exploratory space missions that were conducted by NASA.<br></span></p></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-4de5c081 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="414cd34c-82b5-4c08-9164-e0f1a7b8e8c0" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-02e817f7 pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="62dc2ebe-d9a1-4185-af6b-5ef45d939d6a" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-54962102 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="41fc20aa-b201-44c1-9fa5-a52b7d3ac91d" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-8c894593 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="c20b02c6-98f0-4fcb-9b99-25beb666e7a1" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-2691c95a sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="b02464e4-0225-48be-95c1-af73a60c78d8" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Non la is made of such simple materials</span></h3><p class="pf-713ebcf9 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="170b3ca0-7227-48aa-8754-13f18b085841" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-c94eb87a sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="eefd213a-3e05-4209-8a4d-db596b81488a" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Non la is made out of such simple and available materials as palm leaves, bark of Moc tree and bamboo. Non la is abundantly sold and there are many traditional villages where tourists can get high quality conical hats.<br><br>There is something about parenthood that gives us a sense of history and a deeply rooted desire to send on into the next generation the great things we have discovered about life. And part of that is the desire to instill in our children the love of science, of learning and particularly the love of nature.&nbsp;<br></span></p></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-1d52ee54 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="57a1e5a0-91e0-4f77-a7fc-d17cf580f1fd" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-e0a6970f sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="7e0ac1d7-6d30-4562-95d7-4e768429b7f5" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/imagejpg-1525855819672.jpg"></picture></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-81d02342 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="fa680a06-04d8-4d2d-8ecb-108e3bf45254" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-23395698 pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="6ce84497-dbc0-4bd6-ae71-abde63c75846" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-da73c94d sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="18d2b1b8-ae4e-4942-923c-ff39ebb6e0b0" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-9722dbc2 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="d287aaee-c2cd-4a03-952a-66c9acdf122f" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/imagenonlajpg-1525856260738.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-b56fc38c sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="94072a82-2fbb-4bf0-85b8-56952f427a10" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-5945b84b sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="d54a41dc-c8c3-4dbd-9649-a62c1a030864" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-7c5ababc sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="d95660c1-90e0-42e1-ba03-4406b8cbb948" data-type="Text" draggable="true">The image of Non la</span></h3><p class="pf-a471c737 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="1fba5ec8-94b0-4569-ad1a-7133f2bab559" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-8bb18191 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="9ac701cf-281a-4abe-a42c-501cfd970ad9" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Vietnamese tried to make a hat modelling after the Goddess' by stitching together palm leaves, which is now known as Non la. The image of Non la has become strongly associated with peasant lives from the paddy field to boat men and women.<br><br>Your fascination with the universe and how to explore it as we so often do in the field of astronomy can be highly academic and dry as maybe it was if you took a course in astronomy. But when you get out there in the field at night, your equipment is just right and the night sky comes alive with activity, there is no other experience like it for majesty and pure excitement. And that is the kind of experience we want our children to come to love as much as we do.<br></span></p></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-ddcfb325 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="e9eef6c9-7a89-4dd6-a6ca-0ae163589025" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-a5e53a76 pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="e4a0c872-72ed-402c-88b1-e3be84521146" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-e131096f sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="bb9f19c4-cf7b-41bc-8e5b-67cfa2c4a514" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-9755c37f sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="e0eb57f3-69fc-4eee-9c41-7778f8f88275" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-cd91d51c sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="0850af87-d30e-4df1-ad57-50eb446d72ea" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Non la has numerous uses</span></h3><p class="pf-9a08f7b4 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="3686c75f-ccc7-457c-8632-62d8bd75c008" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-c71d0170 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="be7dd671-c9de-4d5d-9118-1ccb2a8fea3e" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Non la can serve numerous uses such as a personal sun proof, a basket for women going to market, a fan of a ploughman in hot summer days, or even a keepsake to memorize. The image of a young lady wearing Non la and Ao dai is a beautiful symbol of Vietnam.<br><br>It’s actually not a big jump from play to learning for children when it comes to learning about the natural world, science and astronomy. Exploration is a natural part of being a child and growing up in a fascinating world and universe. So if we can find ways to take that natural desire to explore and instill a life long passion for astronomy, we will have given our children a truly great gift.<br></span></p></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths pb-desk--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-3346d3ec sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="fe415404-1fbf-46c2-9b96-f5b1fb857333" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-90596cae sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="76303022-dd5c-40d6-ae94-c970404d0d5b" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/imagenonla1jpg-1525856353837.jpg"></picture></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-a64ed88e sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="758d82fc-5ed0-401f-b101-2bb586482312" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-7f73b93c pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="278a8fda-f59d-4992-a0a8-afcfd3dbb1c4" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-a2776bfb sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="e3933eda-384b-4137-bca6-89855581a241" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h2 mode="edit" class="pf-2f98b9cb sc-cmthru YTQFF" data-element="459fbe3e-c05a-4b0d-873b-f332931ec38c" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-b21d302b sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="d33469ea-6237-4a02-b172-f2f24923f582" data-type="Text" draggable="true"><b>THE HISTORY BEHIND "NON LA".</b></span></h2><p class="pf-561dd9b6 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="44ef8eb3-3bca-4cae-a664-e70a92c49c2d" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-1a176433 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="7ca7262b-cf88-47db-aabd-560de7b2ac9a" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Every country has its own national headgear. The United States has the baseball cap, Britain is famous for the London bobby's helmet. Greece is associated with the fisherman's hat, while the beret is the symbol of France. The Israelis use the yarmulke and we usually see the Saudi Arabians in their white headdresses. Indian Sikhs wrap their heads in elaborate turbans while Russians warm their craniums with fur hats, which are of good use even at fifty Degree Celsius below zero. In Vietnam, the national chapeau is the non, or conical peasant hat. Along with the graceful silk ao dai, the non has become a sort of informal Vietnamese national symbol that is recognized worldwide.</span></p><div class="pf-184cafcc sc-lkqHmb bekBQz" data-element="2ab41d83-0a45-4c49-8228-889199d851d1" data-type="Youtube" draggable="true"><div class="pb-video-wrap " style="padding-bottom: 56.25%;"><iframe class="pb-video" allow="autoplay"></iframe></div></div></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-6e0194aa sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="09f68624-9d66-48bc-9b8c-baece35f95f4" pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="a03cd560-7858-4ba2-985b-34acb23d2607" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-035cef8f sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="1436a215-b51b-4478-af04-272e3c567940" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h2 mode="edit" class="pf-7f3ebda6 sc-cmthru YTQFF" data-element="4a4eafa5-62e5-45d9-8b16-846ed70982e8" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-4c10ff9f sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="0dd3a262-92d8-4a20-ba47-0fbf3715d37e" data-type="Text" draggable="true"><span style="font-weight: 700;">Showcase in modern life</span><br></span></h2></div> </div></div><div class="pf-2bb4825b pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="284a3f1b-5900-4401-af25-75150ba630f6" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div data-element="0165a4af-8813-4020-ac5b-db8600b1505b" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-de08bf3e sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="b1d7abcf-4fa0-48b8-854d-22059447cc68" pb-tablet--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-ee6ae5cc sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="f9a9753d-5a49-4286-bb95-b2c842210e21" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-b3604b33 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="f15728dd-0311-49ac-8567-181967ec9e2f" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-b611b6bd sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="1b580985-07b5-4d78-9659-1cb7035cef4e" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-69bd4877 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="2208437c-4ca9-4580-9d20-2d8817fce684" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/3jpg-1525856943433.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-8c38ea2d sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="a3cddd6d-d3ad-4fdb-883d-e52a9f4a4a47" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-9e8fe01c sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="07385871-d65a-4174-93e6-bb446f4d9b59" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/4jpg-1525856949631.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--one-whole twelfths-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-9e23fbf9 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="b6a1e6f3-01a0-49c2-a29f-fe9c8a25c902" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-46aa8c6c sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="9219551d-2c0a-4549-997d-960679746959" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/5jpg-1525857151467.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--one-whole twelfths-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-77bd54f4 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="9607e2be-8561-4663-866c-83490d668cb5" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><p class="pf-5ce5e763 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="26b42dac-35b6-42a9-a52a-7f81bea95198" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-a5d07aee sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="2f66ff5b-6934-41b4-9626-9af1973cf713" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Like many other traditional costumes of Vietnam, Non la has its own origin, coming from a legend related to the history of rice growing in Vietnam. The story is about a giant woman from the sky who has protected humankind from a deluge of rain. She wore a hat made of four round shaped leaves to guard against all the rain. After the Goddess was gone, Vietnamese built a temple to commemorate her as the Rain-shielding Goddess.<br><br>Among conical hats, the nón lá of the Vietnamese people forms a perfect right circular cone which tapers smoothly from the base to the apex. Special conical hats in Vietnam contain colourful hand-stitch depictions or words while the Huế varieties are famous for their nón bài thơ (literally: poem conical hats). These contain random poetic verses and Hán tự which can be revealed when the hat is directed above one's head in the sunlight. Today, it has become part of Vietnam's national costume.<br></span></p></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-08433a40 sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="2ccdda19-5209-493e-98ee-3dbe4b799135" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-fcac6a7a pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="85e3897d-5eb0-4f54-b371-c89b119dac21" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-38406571 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="6dd1318a-897b-42cd-8e9e-4cdb0fd0bbc8" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h2 mode="edit" class="pf-20b76ec4 sc-cmthru YTQFF" data-element="f7f08656-4762-40d0-bfe9-668e22fd80e7" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-deefb9b0 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="9f6e4ab3-b9e0-4245-9435-e5d23508ffbe" data-type="Text" draggable="true"><span style="font-weight: 700;">Vietnam and its magnificent beauty</span><br></span></h2></div> </div></div><div class="pf-90f5a75a pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="7d2bfbad-0c1f-4d0f-aba5-d1a2896312d0" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--one-whole twelfths-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-6cdec2fc sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="38054400-0db6-4603-bd41-f9690d863a6c" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-ba0fad4f sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="15bbf00a-8a45-405a-8191-a5ad02f8c29a" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/1jpg-1525857686955.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--one-whole twelfths-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-a304c6c0 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="50d32f2f-9364-4099-9578-6cd25a2b0c6a" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><p class="pf-f5a059c0 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="8e7bb56e-913b-4406-8a53-ea508cf31761" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-172cedb3 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="a53ac338-6674-4cc0-9988-796111a1e923" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Vietnam's culture has developed over the centuries from indigenous ancient Đông Sơn culture with wet rice agriculture as its economic base. Some elements of the national culture have Chinese origins, drawing on elements of Confucianism and Taoism in its traditional political system and philosophy. Vietnamese society is structured around làng (ancestral villages); all Vietnamese mark a common ancestral anniversary on the tenth day of the third lunar month. In recent centuries, the influences of Western cultures, most notably France and the United States, have become evident in Vietnam.<br><br>The traditional focuses of Vietnamese culture are humanity and harmony; family and community values are highly regarded. In the modern era, the cultural life of Vietnam has been deeply influenced by government-controlled media and cultural programs. For many decades, foreign cultural influences – especially those of Western origin – were shunned. However, since the 1990s, Vietnam has seen a greater exposure to Southeast Asian, European and American culture and media.<br></span></p></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-8d1915dc sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="39ce79a2-6e10-4eb5-9c81-28b69654f115" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-d4858ee0 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="4c7b17c4-431d-49d4-b131-0484c3eedeae" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/2jpg-1525857693841.jpg"></picture></div> </div><div class="pb-six-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--six-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-a4c878f0 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="0da89d82-29af-4597-baf6-89bf5b14a477" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><picture class="pf-f6ee7aa8 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="99c70cb3-0842-4bd3-9d92-c7ee665e2e8d" data-type="Image" draggable="true"><img src="https://media.pagefly.io/file/get/3jpg-1525857701338.jpg"></picture></div> </div></div></div></div><div data-container="true" class="pf-a319da7c sc-CtfFt hnnCBO" data-element="204dcf7f-590a-4005-8157-5572547c0584" data-type="Section" draggable="true"><div class="sc-rBLzX jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-a17c1879 pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" jlSxrP" style="background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"></div><div class="sc-bMvGRv jKmwkI" style="max-width: 1170px;"><div class="pf-fc802a6c pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="38f8d6ed-0b89-466a-807a-42f33d207186" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="grid__column" style="padding: 15px;"><div class="pf-574a6509 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-type="Divider" draggable="true"></div><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-eff1092d sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="6da74997-53af-4352-99f0-f6557858d00f" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span methods</span></h3></div> </div></div><div class="pf-60e8f93e pb-grid pb-grid--automatic pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="d5dded13-5ec5-46cf-9830-317f8ded23e6" data-type="Row" data-element="d31142e0-22cf-427c-acdd-5f60ae92008e" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-7f1a07b5 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="ec7e5bf6-862d-43b7-b222-0581cfe30296" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Matcha is a type of Japanese green tea. And unlike teas you might be familiar with that you get from tea bags or loose leaves, this unique type is finely ground, powdered green tea.The name is quite fitting since Matcha in Japanese means powder, so the meaning of Matcha green tea is literally powdered green tea.</span></p><picture class="pf-fed2a7a9 sc-iujRgT bbbPjy" data-element="0d5b5690-c30e-493c-885f-b2cd2d16101e" draggable="true">Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. Hopefully one or two of them are also inspiring to you. If not, maybe they will motivate you to create your own motivational sayings.</span></p></div> </div></div><div class="pf-033f5e2d pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="94b9cb86-8465-4734-b910-23c175add8de" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-five-twelfths pb-mobile--five-twelfths pb-tablet--five-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 0px;"><div class="pf-b9af97ae sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="4ec62b07-1e33-493d-afb0-27abc42c0fce" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-3ab5d0ec sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="320423a9-f7d1-4dd3-9bb4-789c2b54319b" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-f4e577df sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="f0fdbe02-6387-473e-8f0e-fd823754529c" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Increasing Prosperity With Positive Thinking</span></h3><p class="pf-7aec578e sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="e4600499-2813-41fc-aec0-23c4e9febdb2" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-49f85bd6 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="8d7a133d-dced-423d-baa3-c52a34ac0122" data-type="Text" draggable="true">“A small trouble is like a pebble. data-element="5b9f6b4f-f60f-4af1-98ea-bd2cca7dcd62" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Burning Desire Golden Key Or Red Herring</span></h3><p class="pf-ba5ddfd1 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="afedd0b3-3316-472f-af8a-a54630bd9e7b" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-34e0b661 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="da730cb4-a459-4c5c-8cec-4c6c210d27ed" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Have you noticed how everybody takes it for granted a bad experience is automatically, unreservedly, unremittingly bad? That nothing good could ever come from a bad childhood, for example? I’m hearing the comment more and more often that we have become a victim society. Every one of these comments sounds a lot like self-pity, like “I can’t be helped because I’ve been scarred beyond reclaim.” Well, maybe all of the bare facts are true, but isn’t it time to start looking for the positives that are buried in all that negative stuff? You can find more than garbage in your past. And all you’ve got to do is learn to look for it.</span></p></div> </div></div><div class="pf-77dc26de pb-grid pb-grid--aligned-center pb-grid--equal-height sc-jzgbtB hVUpPg" data-element="f702e361-28e7-4fcc-8e3a-f2ae77d17cbc" data-type="Row" draggable="true"><div class="pb-five-twelfths pb-mobile--five-twelfths pb-tablet--five-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 0px;"><div class="pf-74c91d38 sc-gFaPwZ dZdWHn" data-element="e396de4b-ff59-4c7d-94dd-f303dcbda06f" data-type="Column" draggable="true"><h3 mode="edit" class="pf-84fa0da1 sc-esOvli fgQlMl" data-element="adacd68d-2f5e-44af-a25f-358436d0e0d6" data-type="Heading" draggable="true"><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-1ff45965 sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="092f16d2-baa3-4fa7-8b29-0b6a492aa6d4" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Self Motivation How To Keep Yourself Motivated</span></h3><p class="pf-86e755d4 sc-eLExRp boGhwv" data-element="169424be-4e70-475e-a6e3-6d824ec2f653" data-type="Paragraph" draggable="true"><span>D</span><span placeholder="Enter text here..." contenteditable="true" class="pf-6c90309a sc-eerKOB jDywVX" data-element="e51ca47c-28d7-4e76-ad9b-f983ed406c4c" data-type="Text" draggable="true">Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning. – Mohandas Karamchand (Mahatma) Gandhi These are quotes that mean something to me. Hopefully one or two of them are also inspiring to you. If not, maybe they will motivate you to create your own motivational sayings.</span></p></div> </div><div class="pb-one-twelfth pb-mobile--one-twelfth pb-tablet--one-twelfth grid__column" means experimenting with a good thought until you find a way to use it in your own recipe for motivation. Suppose, for example, you’re in a difficult situation and don’t feel like dealing with it. As you sit there, you play around with the idea of opportunity coming from difficulty. Fortunately, you discover that it pulls you out of your slump to think about yourself in the future, explaining to a friend how you turned the difficult situation to your advantage.</span></p></div></div> </div><div class="pb-four-twelfths pb-mobile--one-whole twelfths-twelfths pb-tablet--four-twelfths pb-desk--four-twelfths grid__column" style="padding: 0px;"><div jDywVX" data-element="a4304453-d38c-4764-9005-3c9cb7aa431e" data-type="Text" draggable="true">One of my favourite things I like to watch is the bloopers and outtakes that are shown of mistakes made during the making of a movie. Most DVD’s have a section of outtakes to be viewed, and often they will set me off laughing, especially when you know what was supposed to happen. In one sense it seems strange to laugh at other people’s mistakes, and yet we all do it, and our enjoyment is not usually of malicious intent.
